subject: Nutrition
title: Linus Pauling's Vitamin C Crusade
description: A quick, practical guide to Linus Pauling's Vitamin C Crusade.

hook.text: A two-time Nobel laureate spent his final decades claiming megadose vitamin C could cure cancer.

buildup.text: Linus Pauling published a bestselling book in 1970 promoting huge doses of vitamin C for colds.

discovery.text: His fame gave the idea enormous credibility, and millions started taking grams of vitamin C daily.

twist.text: Rigorous clinical trials later found no benefit from megadoses for colds, cancer, or lifespan.

climax.text: Pauling's case became a textbook example of how even brilliant minds can fall into confirmation bias.

punchline.text: Genius doesn't protect you from being wrong.

quiz.question: What did clinical trials find about megadose vitamin C?
options: No benefit for colds or cancer
